newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines' Ramos dismisses wife as successor.
newsitem.headline: Philippines' Ramos dismisses wife as successor.

text.p: President Fidel Ramos on Wednesday dismissed as "fantasy" suggestions his wife run as a presidential candidate so he could still direct Philippine affairs behind the scenes when he steps down in 1998.
"You laughed as you were making the question, so did Mrs Ramos and so did I," Ramos told his weekly news conference.
A citizens group calling itself Presidential Movement for Ming Ramos has urged the drafting of Ramos's wife, Amelita, as a candidate in next year's presidential election.
Ramos, whose term ends in June 1998, is barred from running for re-election under a constitutional provision that limits a president to only one six-year term.
Manila newspapers on Wednesday quoted a leader of the group as saying if Mrs Ramos, popularly called "Ming," is elected, her husband "can still run the show."
"You know I am against dynasties in the political field," Ramos said laughing.
